dom-document-getselection.name: getSelection
dom-document-getselection.summary: The getSelection() method of the Document interface returns a Selection object representing the range of text selected by the user, or the current position of the caret.
dom-document-getselection.title: Document: getSelection() method

selectionchange-event.name: selectionchange_event
selectionchange-event.summary: The selectionchange event of the Selection API is fired when the current Selection of a Document is changed.
selectionchange-event.title: Document: selectionchange event

selectionchange-event.name: selectionchange_event
selectionchange-event.summary: The selectionchange event of the Selection API is fired when the text selection within an <input> element is changed. This includes both changes in the selected range of characters, or if the caret moves.

chrome.notes: A selectionchange event is fired on Document, see Document's selectionchange event. See bug 1327098 for firing the event on <input> elements.

edge_blink.notes: A selectionchange event is fired on Document, see Document's selectionchange event. See bug 1327098 for firing the event on <input> elements.

selectionchange-event.title: HTMLInputElement: selectionchange event

selectionchange-event.name: selectionchange_event
selectionchange-event.summary: The selectionchange event of the Selection API is fired when the text selection within an <textarea> element is changed. This includes both changes in the selected range of characters, or if the caret moves.

chrome.notes: A selectionchange event is fired on Document, see Document's selectionchange event. See bug 1327098 for firing the event on <textarea> elements.

edge_blink.notes: A selectionchange event is fired on Document, see Document's selectionchange event. See bug 1327098 for firing the event on <textarea> elements.

selectionchange-event.title: HTMLTextAreaElement: selectionchange event

dom-globaleventhandlers-onselectionchang.name: selectionchange_event
dom-globaleventhandlers-onselectionchang.summary: The selectionchange event of the Selection API is fired when the current Selection of a Document is changed.
dom-globaleventhandlers-onselectionchang.title: Document: selectionchange event

dom-globaleventhandlers-onselectionchang.name: selectionchange_event
dom-globaleventhandlers-onselectionchang.summary: The selectionchange event of the Selection API is fired when the text selection within an <input> element is changed. This includes both changes in the selected range of characters, or if the caret moves.

chrome.notes: A selectionchange event is fired on Document, see Document's selectionchange event. See bug 1327098 for firing the event on <input> elements.

edge_blink.notes: A selectionchange event is fired on Document, see Document's selectionchange event. See bug 1327098 for firing the event on <input> elements.

dom-globaleventhandlers-onselectionchang.title: HTMLInputElement: selectionchange event

dom-globaleventhandlers-onselectionchang.name: selectionchange_event
dom-globaleventhandlers-onselectionchang.summary: The selectionchange event of the Selection API is fired when the text selection within an <textarea> element is changed. This includes both changes in the selected range of characters, or if the caret moves.

chrome.notes: A selectionchange event is fired on Document, see Document's selectionchange event. See bug 1327098 for firing the event on <textarea> elements.

edge_blink.notes: A selectionchange event is fired on Document, see Document's selectionchange event. See bug 1327098 for firing the event on <textarea> elements.

dom-globaleventhandlers-onselectionchang.title: HTMLTextAreaElement: selectionchange event

extensions-to-document-interface.name: Document
extensions-to-document-interface.summary: The Document interface represents any web page loaded in the browser and serves as an entry point into the web page's content, which is the DOM tree.
extensions-to-document-interface.title: Document

selectstart-event.name: selectstart_event
selectstart-event.summary: The selectstart event of the Selection API is fired when a user starts a new selection.
selectstart-event.title: Node: selectstart event

dom-globaleventhandlers-onselectstart.name: selectstart_event
dom-globaleventhandlers-onselectstart.summary: The selectstart event of the Selection API is fired when a user starts a new selection.
dom-globaleventhandlers-onselectstart.title: Node: selectstart event

dom-selection-addrange.name: addRange
dom-selection-addrange.summary: The Selection.addRange() method adds a Range to a Selection.
dom-selection-addrange.title: Selection: addRange() method

dom-selection-anchornode.name: anchorNode
dom-selection-anchornode.summary: The Selection.anchorNode read-only property returns the Node in which the selection begins.
dom-selection-anchornode.title: Selection: anchorNode property

dom-selection-anchoroffset.name: anchorOffset
dom-selection-anchoroffset.summary: The Selection.anchorOffset read-only property returns the number of characters that the selection's anchor is offset within the Selection.anchorNode.
dom-selection-anchoroffset.title: Selection: anchorOffset property

dom-selection-collapse.name: collapse
dom-selection-collapse.summary: The Selection.collapse() method collapses the current selection to a single point. The document is not modified. If the content is focused and editable, the caret will blink there.
dom-selection-collapse.title: Selection: collapse() method

dom-selection-collapse.name: setPosition
dom-selection-collapse.summary: The Selection.collapse() method collapses the current selection to a single point. The document is not modified. If the content is focused and editable, the caret will blink there.
dom-selection-collapse.title: Selection: collapse() method

dom-selection-collapsetoend.name: collapseToEnd
dom-selection-collapsetoend.summary: The Selection.collapseToEnd() method collapses the selection to the end of the last range in the selection. If the content of the selection is focused and editable, the caret will blink there.
dom-selection-collapsetoend.title: Selection: collapseToEnd() method

dom-selection-collapsetostart.name: collapseToStart
dom-selection-collapsetostart.summary: The Selection.collapseToStart() method collapses the selection to the start of the first range in the selection. If the content of the selection is focused and editable, the caret will blink there.
dom-selection-collapsetostart.title: Selection: collapseToStart() method

dom-selection-containsnode.name: containsNode
dom-selection-containsnode.summary: The Selection.containsNode() method indicates whether a specified node is part of the selection.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 35, the method didn't throw if node was null.

dom-selection-containsnode.title: Selection: containsNode() method

dom-selection-deletefromdocument.name: deleteFromDocument
dom-selection-deletefromdocument.summary: The deleteFromDocument() method of the Selection interface deletes the selected text from the document's DOM.
dom-selection-deletefromdocument.title: Selection: deleteFromDocument() method

dom-selection-removeallranges.name: empty
dom-selection-removeallranges.summary: The Selection.removeAllRanges() method removes all ranges from the selection, leaving the anchorNode and focusNode properties equal to null and nothing selected. When this method is called, a selectionchange event is fired at the document.
dom-selection-removeallranges.title: Selection: removeAllRanges() method

dom-selection-removeallranges.name: removeAllRanges
dom-selection-removeallranges.summary: The Selection.removeAllRanges() method removes all ranges from the selection, leaving the anchorNode and focusNode properties equal to null and nothing selected. When this method is called, a selectionchange event is fired at the document.
dom-selection-removeallranges.title: Selection: removeAllRanges() method

dom-selection-extend.name: extend
dom-selection-extend.summary: The Selection.extend() method moves the focus of the selection to a specified point. The anchor of the selection does not move. The selection will be from the anchor to the new focus, regardless of direction.
dom-selection-extend.title: Selection: extend() method

dom-selection-focusnode.name: focusNode
dom-selection-focusnode.summary: The Selection.focusNode read-only property returns the Node in which the selection ends.
dom-selection-focusnode.title: Selection: focusNode property

dom-selection-focusoffset.name: focusOffset
dom-selection-focusoffset.summary: The Selection.focusOffset read-only property returns the number of characters that the selection's focus is offset within the Selection.focusNode.
dom-selection-focusoffset.title: Selection: focusOffset property

dom-selection-getrangeat.name: getRangeAt
dom-selection-getrangeat.summary: The Selection.getRangeAt() method returns a range object representing one of the ranges currently selected.
dom-selection-getrangeat.title: Selection: getRangeAt() method

dom-selection-iscollapsed.name: isCollapsed
dom-selection-iscollapsed.summary: The Selection.isCollapsed read-only property returns a boolean value which indicates whether or not there is currently any text selected. No text is selected when the selection's start and end points are at the same position in the content.
dom-selection-iscollapsed.title: Selection: isCollapsed property

dom-selection-modify.name: modify
dom-selection-modify.summary: The Selection.modify() method applies a change to the current selection or cursor position, using simple textual commands.
dom-selection-modify.title: Selection: modify() method

dom-selection-rangecount.name: rangeCount
dom-selection-rangecount.summary: The Selection.rangeCount read-only property returns the number of ranges in the selection.
dom-selection-rangecount.title: Selection: rangeCount property

dom-selection-removerange.name: removeRange
dom-selection-removerange.summary: The Selection.removeRange() method removes a range from a selection.
dom-selection-removerange.title: Selection: removeRange() method

dom-selection-selectallchildren.name: selectAllChildren
dom-selection-selectallchildren.summary: The Selection.selectAllChildren() method adds all the children of the specified node to the selection. Previous selection is lost.
dom-selection-selectallchildren.title: Selection: selectAllChildren() method

dom-selection-setbaseandextent.name: setBaseAndExtent
dom-selection-setbaseandextent.summary: The setBaseAndExtent() method of the Selection interface sets the selection to be a range including all or parts of two specified DOM nodes, and any content located between them.
dom-selection-setbaseandextent.title: Selection: setBaseAndExtent() method

dom-selection-stringifier.name: toString
dom-selection-stringifier.summary: The Selection.toString() method returns a string currently being represented by the selection object, i.e. the currently selected text.
dom-selection-stringifier.title: Selection: toString() method

dom-selection-type.name: type
dom-selection-type.summary: The type read-only property of the Selection interface returns a string describing the type of the current selection.
dom-selection-type.title: Selection: type property

selection-interface.name: Selection
selection-interface.summary: A Selection object represents the range of text selected by the user or the current position of the caret. To obtain a Selection object for examination or manipulation, call window.getSelection().
selection-interface.title: Selection

dom-window-getselection.name: getSelection
dom-window-getselection.summary: The Window.getSelection() method returns a Selection object representing the range of text selected by the user or the current position of the caret.
dom-window-getselection.title: Window: getSelection() method
